page.title: 13Roddymoor & surrounding area
page.content: Roddymoor was built so that the men who worked on the railway line and down the mines in the area had somewhere to live, near to their place of work. When the mines and the railway that served it closed down the area was used as a site for a chemical works.However this to closed down and the Open Cast moved in. The area around Roddymoor was one of the first to be mined and has now being restored and put back to grass.There are few trees in the region because they were pulled out when the land was opencasted. There is a playing field near the houses which are mainly terraced with a General Store and Post Office combined. The farms in the area are mainly Dairy with herds of Jersey cows while the sheep were Scottish black face breed.
